name: word4you
title: Word4you
description: Query English words with AI-powered explanations using Google Gemini and save them to your vocabulary notebook in markdown file. Supports Git backup for vocabulary management.
author: gnehz972

commands.name: learn-word
commands.title: Learn Word
commands.subtitle: Word4You
commands.description: Search saved words or query new words with AI explanations

preferences.name: geminiApiKey
preferences.title: Gemini API Key
preferences.description: Your Google Gemini API key for AI word explanations

preferences.name: vocabularyBaseDir
preferences.title: Vocabulary Base Directory
preferences.description: Base directory where 'word4you' subdirectory will be created (leave empty for default: home directory)

preferences.name: gitRemoteUrl
preferences.title: Git Remote URL
preferences.description: Git repository URL for vocabulary notebook backup (SSH URLs only)

preferences.name: sshPrivateKeyPath
preferences.title: SSH Private Key Path
preferences.description: Path to SSH private key file for Git authentication (leave empty for default: ~/.ssh/id_ed25519)

preferences.name: sshPublicKeyPath
preferences.title: SSH Public Key Path
preferences.description: Path to SSH public key file for Git authentication (leave empty for default: ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub)

preferences.name: geminiModelName
preferences.title: Gemini Model Name
preferences.description: Gemini model name to use for AI explanations (leave empty for default: gemini-2.0-flash-001)

preferences.name: gitEnabled
preferences.title: Enable Git Operations
preferences.description: Enable automatic Git commit and push operations when saving words
preferences.label: Enable Git operations

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
